title: Ankyloblepharon Filiforme Adnatum: Report of Two Cases
patient: A 2-day-old male infant was admitted to the eye ward of our hospital on April 2, 2011 with similar signs as in case 1 [Figure and ]. Family history and antenatal history was unremarkable. On examination, fine extensible bands similar to as in case 1 were found in both eyes. Systemic examination did not reveal any abnormalities except a tuft of hair over the lumbosacral area proximal to the cleavage []. The patient was managed as in case 1.\nBoth infants presented for follow up at one month and no abnormality was detected.
